pr_title: set content for tutorial loading page

timeline.message: set content for tutorial loading page

timeline.bodyText: Is there a more appropriate ARIA role to suggest that the "stuff" in here isn't relevant to a screen reader? (Since these are just divs that form an animation)
timeline.author: kevinushey

replies.bodyText:
Yes, as this is it would be flagged as a violation due to no label on the image (same as an img tag without an alt) and a screen reader would say "image" with no other info when navigating the page.
Easiest fix is to remove role="img" and screen readers will skip over this.
replies.author: gtritchie

timeline.message: avoid using host page URL (for proxies)

timeline.bodyText: Minor (change if you want): Don't think this should be a heading, just a styled div or p. A heading gets special treatment by screen readers and implies there is more content nested under the header.
timeline.author: gtritchie

timeline.message: avoid unnecessary ARIA role; use plain
